did.unittitle: Gustav Davidson Papers

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in two series: Personal Papers; Books and Ephemera.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Materials donated to DCA by Babette Bandler in 1999.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: DCA received materials in ten shipping boxes. The majority of the boxes contained books. Processor cataloged the books in each box to determine whether an original order existed. Cataloged information included: Title; Author; Year of Publication; Extent; Dedications/Signatures; Binding information; If a dustjacket was present; Whether book was illustrated; Illustrator; Whether there was correspondence in book; Box number; Whether book needed a phase box; Any notes, context, or topics of interest; and Whether book was listed in Worldcat. A hardcopy of this information is available in the collection documentation in the DCA office. Some books were found to be housed in plastic bags with other titles by the same author or on the same subject. These groupings were recorded in the Notes Field and books were removed from the bags. Any labels from these bags are currently housed in folder MS038/002-004:00001. No specific order could be discerned and books were therefore arranged according to author's last name. Many books contained correspondence, clippings and other materials within their textblocks. Any materials considered to be threat to the condition of the book were removed to corresponding envelopes. Notes document cross-referencing removed material in the finding aid and on book slips. Some smaller materials not at risk of damaging the book were left in place. Fragile or damaged books were housed in individual phase boxes within the larger box.

Additional papers and photographs found in the boxes were arranged according to subject. In a few isolated cased a book was included with the papers because it was intrinsically linked to these materials. Collection was processed by Veronica Martzahl, 7/6/2007, supervised by Susanne Belovari.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The majority of the collection consists of books from Davidson's personal collection; some correspondence, clippings, photographs and promotional brochures are interfiled with the books. Also included are photographs, clippings, diaries, correspondence, drawings, awards, poems, programs, bulletins, and publications. Much of the correspondence relates to Davidson's duties as Secretary of the Poetry Society of America, a position he held from 1949 to 1965.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Gustav Davidson was born in Warsaw, Poland on December 25, 1895. His family moved to New York City in 1897. He received his bachelor's and master's degrees from Columbia University in 1919 and 1920 respectively. During the twenties and thirties, he wrote and published both dramatic works and poetry and founded and edited several literary magazines. In 1940 he founded Fine Editions Press. An integral part of the American poetry establishment through the 1960s, Davidson served as executive secretary of the Poetry Society of America from 1949 to 1965, after which time he was elected executive secretary emeritus. Also in 1965, he published his most well known book, A Dictionary of Angels, Including the Fallen Angels. Davidson married Mollie Strauss in 1942. He died February 6, 1971 in New York City.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. Any intellectual property rights that the donor possesses have not been transferred to Tufts University.

did.unittitle: Personal Papers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of photographs, clippings, correspondence, diaries, drawings, awards, poems, programs, bulletins, and publications.

Much of this material relates to Davidson's work at the Poetry Society of America and to writers he knew. Also included is material related to his work with the Kennedy Foundation and the Steuben Glass "Exhibit in Crystal."

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged alphabetically by name or subject.

did.unittitle: Books and Ephemera

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes books and all related materials originally interfiled or located with these books. These materials include, but are not limited to, correspondence, clippings, photographs and promotional brochures. The majority of materials were removed from their corresponding books, rehoused in envelopes or folders, cataloged, and cross-referenced (book slips and finding aid). When interfiled material was not at risk of damaging a book, it was not removed. The description field contains a description of such items. Book cataloging includes: dedication/signature, publication information/first edition, condition and description, material/ephemera included, and what other material was stored in the same bag (most books had been stored in plastic shopping bags). Additional cataloging information is available in collection documentation folder.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged alphabetically by author's last name. Any related materials directly follow book listing.
